Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.serverNetwork

Class ClientConnection

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.serverNetwork.ClientConnection
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class ClientConnection
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
Class ClientConnection handles the connection between a client and the server. It contains methods to receive and send messages through the socket and other utility methods.

  • Field Summary

    private boolean active

    private java.io.ObjectInputStream input  
    private java.io.ObjectOutputStream output  
    private java.lang.String playerNickname

    private java.net.Socket socket

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    ClientConnection​(java.net.Socket socket, Server server)
    Creates a new ClientConnection object and instantiates the input and output streams.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private boolean checkLeadCardSelection​(LeaderCardSelection message)
    Checks if the index provided in the leader card selection message are valid.
    private boolean checkMessageMultiplayer​(GamePhase phase)
    Checks if the the game controller is a multiplayer one, if the game phase is equal to the one provided and if the player is the current player.
    private boolean checkMessageSinglePlayer​(GamePhase phase)
    Checks if the the game controller is a single player one and if the game phase is equal to the one provided.
    private boolean checkResourceSelection​(ResourceSelection message)
    Checks if the resources provided in the resource selection message are not of type FAITHPOINT and if their amount is the one specified by the game rule.
    void close()
    Terminates the connection with the client by closing the socket.
    GameController getGameController()
    Returns the game controller associated with this ClientConnection object.
    java.lang.String getPlayerNickname()
    Returns the nickname of the player associated with this ClientConnection object.
    private boolean isPlayerTurn()
    Checks if the current player of the game is the one associated with this ClientConnection object.
    void messageHandler​(Message clientMessage)
    Handles a message received from the client by calling different methods and sending different server messages depending on the input provided.
    void readInput()
    Reads a message from the client and calls messageHandler(Message) method to handle it.
    void run()
    Reads messages from the socket.
    void sendSocketMessage​(Message message)
    Sends a message to client through the socket.
    void setGameController​(GameController gameController)
    Sets the game controller associated with this ClientConnection object.

  • Constructor Details

    • ClientConnection

      public ClientConnection​(java.net.Socket socket, Server server)
      Creates a new ClientConnection object and instantiates the input and output streams.
      Parameters:
      socket - the socket which accepted the client connection
      server - the main server object

  • Method Details

    • close

      public void close()
      Terminates the connection with the client by closing the socket.

    • getGameController

      public GameController getGameController()
      Returns the game controller associated with this ClientConnection object.
      Returns:
      the associated game controller

    • setGameController

      public void setGameController​(GameController gameController)
      Sets the game controller associated with this ClientConnection object.
      Parameters:
      gameController - the new game controller

    • readInput

      public void readInput() throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
      Reads a message from the client and calls messageHandler(Message) method to handle it.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when the client is not online anymore
      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - when the class of the serializable object cannot be found

    • run

      public void run()
      Reads messages from the socket. When the client disconnects, if the game phase is set to STARTED it calls the Server.unregisterClient(ClientConnection) and changes the if the player was the current player. All the other disconnections are handled by calling the Server.removeClient(ClientConnection) method.
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable
      See Also:
      Runnable.run()

    • messageHandler

      public void messageHandler​(Message clientMessage)
      Handles a message received from the client by calling different methods and sending different server messages depending on the input provided.
      Parameters:
      clientMessage - the message received from the client

    • checkMessageMultiplayer

      private boolean checkMessageMultiplayer​(GamePhase phase)
      Checks if the the game controller is a multiplayer one, if the game phase is equal to the one provided and if the player is the current player.
      Parameters:
      phase - the game phase
      Returns:
      true if the condition is verified, false otherwise

    • checkMessageSinglePlayer

      private boolean checkMessageSinglePlayer​(GamePhase phase)
      Checks if the the game controller is a single player one and if the game phase is equal to the one provided.
      Parameters:
      phase - the game phase
      Returns:
      true if the condition is verified, false otherwise

    • isPlayerTurn

      private boolean isPlayerTurn()
      Checks if the current player of the game is the one associated with this ClientConnection object.
      Returns:
      true if the condition is verified, false otherwise

    • checkLeadCardSelection

      private boolean checkLeadCardSelection​(LeaderCardSelection message)
      Checks if the index provided in the leader card selection message are valid.
      Parameters:
      message - the leader card selection message
      Returns:
      true if the condition is verified, false otherwise

    • checkResourceSelection

      private boolean checkResourceSelection​(ResourceSelection message)
      Checks if the resources provided in the resource selection message are not of type FAITHPOINT and if their amount is the one specified by the game rule.
      Parameters:
      message - the resource selection message
      Returns:
      true if the condition is verified, false otherwise

    • sendSocketMessage

      public void sendSocketMessage​(Message message)
      Sends a message to client through the socket.
      Parameters:
      message - to message to send to the client

    • getPlayerNickname

      public java.lang.String getPlayerNickname()
      Returns the nickname of the player associated with this ClientConnection object.
      Returns:
